did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia (Boxes 1042680-1042689 and 1137633-1137638) are found at the Library of Virginia.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Essex County (Va.) County Court Records, 1683-1912, undated. Local government records collection, Essex County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Boxes 1042680-1042689 came to the Virginia State Library (now the Library of Virginia) under accession number 21817.
Boxes 1137633-1137638 came to the Virginia State Library (now the Library of Virginia) under accession number 29400.
The volumes came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Essex County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Essex County was formed from old Rappahannock County in 1692. The county was probably named for the English county or perhaps for Algernon Capell, second earl of Essex.
These items were originally created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Essex County (Va.) County Court Records, 1683-1912, found at the Library of Virginia include 8 boxes of unprocessed Executions, a box of unprocessed suit papers, and 7 boxes of processed Judgments.

Essex County (Va.) County Court Records, 1695-1874,undated, found at the State Records Center include 3 Order Books (one of which is a transcript), 1 Order Book which also contains a List of Acting Magistrates, 3 Judgment Rule Books, 1 Rule Book, 1 Chancery Reference Book, 1 undated Index to Execution Books and 9 Execution Books.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Essex County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
